meanings.def: relating to the most basic and important parts of something; complete and detailed
examples: the need for radical changes in education
demands for radical reform of the law
This document marks a radical departure from earlier recommendations.

meanings.def: new, different and likely to have a great effect
examples: a radical solution to the problem

meanings.def: in favour of extreme and complete political or social change
examples: the radical wing of the party

meanings.def: a group of atoms that behave as a single unit in a number of compounds
